title: Kirchhoff junction - compare I-bat I-R and I-2R

content.question: The figure shows a circuit consisting of a battery and four resistors with the resistances indicated. The current supplied by the battery is <math alttext="I sub Battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Bat</mtext></msub></math>, and the currents in the lower-left and lower-right resistors are <math alttext="I sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>, respectively. How do the currents <math alttext="I sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> compare, and how does <math alttext="I sub Battery" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Bat</mtext></msub></math> compare to the sum <math alttext="I sub R, end sub, plus I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="I sub R, equals I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub Battery, equals I sub R, end sub, plus I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Bat</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="I sub R, equals I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub Battery, is greater than I sub R, end sub, plus I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Bat</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="I sub R, is greater than I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub Battery, equals I sub R, end sub, plus I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Bat</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="I sub R, is greater than I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub Battery, is greater than I sub R, end sub, plus I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Bat</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="I sub R, is greater than I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math alttext="I sub Battery, equals I sub R, end sub, plus I sub 2 R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>Bat</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
